line.token: * Provides an {@link FormField} which allows form to validate for non-bot submissions
* by giving them a honey pot
* list of fields that can be placed as honey pots
* you can add your own one here...
"Please leave this field blank to stop spam"
* minimum number of seconds for a user to complete a form
* maximum number of seconds for a user to complete a form
* also consider: height: 0px; overflow: hidden; etc...
* returns the field name being used
// don't bother querying the SimplestSpam-service if fields were empty
"Could not process submission. It seemed to be a spam attack, if you are not a spammer then please reload form and try again."
"Could not process submission. It seems that your submission took shorter than expected, which indicates a possible spam attack. Please reload the page and try again."
"Could not process submission. It seems that your submission took longer than expected, which indicates a possible spam attack. Please reload the page and try again."
"] field. This field is added to prevent spam (Spammers will complete it - you should not complete it)."
* returns the key of the field to be used...
